name: Hyatt Regency Nice Palais de la Mediterranee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The primelocation of this property really does it. It has beach views and a great outside pool on the front balcony whcih is second to none. Awesome. The rooms are OK, not sepcial if you are used to Sheratons, Hiltons etc. We únfortunately had 'city view' which meant looking over some apartments blocks. did not really see the city at all.
reviews.title: Good location. OK rooms and services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and had all comfort. Breakfast was not that great but regular France visitors know tha tyou should never expect much from a French breaky. Actually for French standards it was great, but as the hotel caters for many foreigners it could be better.
reviews.title: Real style and charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel could not be in a better position.Facing the sea and right across from the Promenade de Englaise.All rooms have a good size balcony I always choose a city view on a high floor they are not only quiter they are also a lot cheaper than the sea view rooms.Shops and restaurants are just a couple of minuets away.Breakfast is a highlight and sujest one books room and breakfast.You cannot start your day any better, it set up by the pool overlooking the azure blue sea.The staff are friendly and most helpfull.The concierge are most informative.I canot rate this hotel highly enough and have returned to it every year for the past six years.The price is a bit on the high side however after staying there I hope that you decide the same as me, that it was worth it.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!! People, people, people!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I go to Nice at least once every year and there is no other place I want to stay but this hotel!! If it's not available for my dates, I change my dates...that's how strongly I feel about it! The location is second to none...right on the Promenade overlooking the gorgeous Mediterranean Sea. It's walking distance to everything. While it's a big hotel, you feel like you have just come home from the minute you enter the lobby. Many of the staff members make an effort to know you by name, they are always smiling and eager to please. The concierge I just cannot say enough of...they are a group of the most friendly, helpful, knowledgeable people in all of Nice! They are the same people I see year after year and have become old friends. Brice in particular is outstanding!! If you have never stayed here and wondering if you should, my advice is to give this hotel a try if for no other reason but it's concierge staff and it's location...you won't be disappointed!!
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 2/6-2/9. 1st time in Nice. The hotel is wonderful. From the front desk, porters to concierge services, simply amazing. Vincent and Brice were so helpful and friendly. I would not stay at any other hotel when we come back to Nice. My husbands birthday was on the 8th and they had a wonderfully decorated cake in our room.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We took a family vacation here over Christmas and the town was alive with excitiment and the Palais de la Mediterranee was within walking distance of it all. The hotel had a very nice staff and we were well taken care of. The hotel also has a wonderful breakfast, bar, and swimming pool. It has parking but costs about 30 Euro ($40 US) per night and a casino is connected to it. Best of all was the fact that the sea and promenade is literally across the street. Worth the extra money to stay here if you want location and luxury.
reviews.title: Great Place for Visiting the French Riviera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I last stayed at this Hotel in December 2011 over the Christmas period and wrote a glowing review. We decided to revisit Nice for Christmas 2012 and hoped that things had not changed (as they often do !) . We should not have worried as the high standards have been maintained. I booked some 6 weeks or so before the visit via Trivago and obtained a very good B&B rate ( I always avoid half board in Nice as there are so many quality eating places within a few hundred yards of the Hotel). The staff are friendly throughout the hotel which makes such a difference when staying away from home. The buffet breakfast is excellent and sets you up for the day! A restaurant worth a visit is nearby in a side street (14 Rue Halevy ) and offers a fixed price 3 course meal for 19 euros--the restaurant is Le Lodge. I have stayed in several 'top' hotels in Nice but have not found one as good as the 'Palais'. We will return!
reviews.title: Nic at its Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: wonderful hotel. location brilliant. staff outstanding!!! couldn't fault it. can't wait to go back here again. the one and only thing I would say was they wanted 100 euro for late check out which we thought very expensive especially this time of year! the concierge specially was outstanding in their help!
reviews.title: absolutely perfect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my Honeymoon in the french riviera, i have stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. i a nice hotel on the beach (but no private beach) of Nice. the location is good & the most thing i liked about this hotel is the huge lobby. from this hotel i drove to Monte Carlo & Cannes. the hotel is Nice but expensive.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to have stayed in the Panoramic Suite situated on the top floor with a large terrace overlooking the arching beach as far as the eyes could see. Too bad it was during autumn, otherwise we would have utilised and enjoyed the terrace much more.
reviews.title: Breath taking views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel whilst work is going on in our house and I expected it to be overrated being on the Promenade des Anglais. This turned out to be by far the best hotel we had stayed in during our two years moving into Nice. There is attention to detail ranging from the complimentary daily bottles of water to the free juice, sweets and superb macarones presented as welcome gestures. There was also a coffee machine with generous capsules to satisfy my caffeine addiction. The rooms are quiet with nice touches and, ulike many hotels in Nice, well insulated. The bathroom products were also first class and even the towels were extra delicate (fair trade). The bathroom itself was spacious with a bathtub and a separte shower whilts the toilet was located separately. Breakfast was very satisfying too with excellent bread. This was my first perfect staty in Nice. Four full days with not one tiny thing to complain about.
reviews.title: Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving to Nice from Marseilles, we were greeted from the very beginning with valets to the reception with exceptional service. Our room was just short of the top floor, so the view was a bit obstructed, but otherwise, caught the lovely sunrise and sunsets in all its glory. The hotel is practically on the beach, with an esplanade and perfect weather. The waiters of the cafe at the beach is another story altogether though.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Fabulous City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was big and roomy and bright which I loved. The bath is the same, big, roomy and bright and everything worked like clockwork. Service was incredible and I would recommend it to anyone. We were a bit apprehensive after we booked and were told that it may not be the right hotel as it is too noisy and big and blah blah. Absolutely rubbish. The hotel was perfect.
reviews.title: Great location and nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't find fault with this hotel. Arrived 3hrs ahead of check in time but was told our room was ready. The staff on reception and at the concierge desk were always polite, friendly and very helpful. A restaurant they recommended for dinner was exquisite and their help with the buses was invaluable. It's a good location and is walking distance to the main shopping areas, the port and the old town.
reviews.title: PERFECT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, nicely decorated and furnished. The only thing missing was tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom has a bath and separate shower, hairdryer, large fluffy towels, robes, slippers, heated towel rail and nice toiletries. The toilet is separate and the dressing area and wardrobes can be shut off from the bedroom.
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE HOTEL and STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid July. Arrived shortly before noon and our room was not ready; back from lunch around 2pm and it was ready then.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant
Many Euros, little service!
reviews.text: The ocean-view room is large; separate toilet, big bathroom (separate shower booth and tub), closet on the other side. There is a door that separates bath/toilet area from the bedroom. The bed is new, nice and firm, with feather comforter. In the balcony there is a table with two chairs where we could have breakfast and drinks. The concierge was friendly but was not so timely in responding to our needs. Our rate included the breakfast which was very nice. In this area there is a busy main street which separates the beach and the hotels, so you may feel a bit noisy staying ocean side. Overall we were very pleased to have chosen this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay thanks to the beautiful location and staff's courtesy.
reviews.title: Outstanding location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: De Luxe rooms have a terrace in front of the sea and at night we got asleep listening to the backwash of the sea.
reviews.title: A big disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Will definitely choose this hotel on my next trip to Nice.
reviews.title: Disappointed, cheated and not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Only one recommendation: our De Luxe room (on 6th floor), despite the "recent renovation", already needed to be refreshed again (moquettes and floor were stained).
reviews.title: Beautiful property with fantastic gym/pool but sterile and not what I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is rated one of the best in Nice. I expected top notch service and amenities.
reviews.title: Good stay over Xmas 2012!

aka: Le Palais De La Mediterranee Hotel Nice
